Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the extent to which Hillary Clinton laundered money to Bill Clinton through Laureate Education. There is no evidence to support this claim.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence to support the accusation that Hillary Clinton laundered money to Bill Clinton through Laureate Education.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the $16.5 million paid to Bill Clinton by Laureate Education was a result of money laundering, without providing any evidence to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation for the $16.5 million paid to Bill Clinton by Laureate Education, which is that it was his compensation as honorary chancellor of the organization.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Laureate Education did not receive any funding from the federal government while Hillary Clinton was secretary of state, according to the usaspending.gov database.
Understate: There is no understatement bias present in the claim.
Falters at times: There is no evidence of the claim faltering at times.
